column4: I tried installing ubuntu on my external HDD and did NOT disconnect the SATA cables. now when I boot, it gives me error 21 or error 5. What must I do? I have fedora and windows xp installed on my machine
What is installed on the internal?
fdedora 12 and windows xo
Can my data and OS be recovered?

Boot from the internal by selecting it in the BIOS, grub should load. Boot Ubuntu and run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure grub-pc" to configure the grub pacakge to install to the external rather than the internal drive (Select only your external drive and *no* partitions).
Then reboot and this time boot fedora and run: su -c "grub-install /dev/sda"
Assuming that your internal drive is sda.
I intalled from a live cd and selected only the external HDD. without partitions and I used the entire HDD
I'll try your suggestion and get back. THanks
You're welcome.
i made my system boot from the internal HD but still it says: *Grub 1.5* Loading GRUB. Then 'Error 21'
Any other drives?
just got my internal HD and the external containing ubuntu, . I have a live CD though
Can you run boot info script as explained here http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt ?
the link you gave me requires me to run commands. But I cant even type. Wahat do I do
Boot a LiveCD.
and then run the commands on the link you gave me?
Yes, though by then I might not be here to read the boot info script output.
oh no.
Here is a guide for re-installing grub2 from a LiveCD which may be usefull: http://grub.enbug.org/Grub2LiveCdInstallGuide
I hope the contents of my internal HD aren't disturbed because of the ubuntu installation.
I am positive that I installed ubuntu only on the exteral HDD without any partitions.
